title: Satisficing vs Optimizing
content: Under time pressure, satisficing beats optimizing. Satisficing means choosing the first option that meets minimum acceptable criteria. Optimizing means evaluating all options to find the best. When time is short, good enough now beats perfect too late. Know your minimum acceptable criteria in advance.

mcq.question: You need to decide now and have three options. Option A meets all critical requirements. Options B and C might be better but require more evaluation. Time is short. What do you choose?

options.A: Take more time to evaluate B and C
options.B: Choose Aâ€”it meets requirements and you can decide now

mcq.explanation: Satisficing: A meets minimum criteria and can be chosen now. Evaluating B and C for potential better outcome costs time you don't have. Choose the satisfactory option.

openQuestions: When is satisficing appropriate versus optimizing?
What are your minimum acceptable criteria for critical operational decisions?
